wiki_catalogs.name: System Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the overall system architecture of the persona application. Explain its purpose as an AI-powered personalized education platform for massage therapy students, detailing how user profiles, surveys, and AI-driven content generation work together. Document the high-level flow from survey submission to personalized lesson delivery, including integration points with Supabase, OpenAI, and external LMS platforms like GetCourse. Include architectural diagrams illustrating data flow between frontend, API routes, database, and file storage. Provide context on the business goals, target users (students, admins, developers), and key technical decisions such as using Next.js App Router with React Server Components. Highlight the role of JSON templates in the personalization engine and explain fallback mechanisms when AI processing fails. Make this accessible to new developers while providing sufficient depth for technical stakeholders.

wiki_catalogs.name: Template Loading Strategy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the template loading mechanism used by the personalization engine. Explain how the system resolves lesson templates from the file system using the getLessonId function and filename patterns (e.g., {number}-{id}-final.json). Document the fallback chain for template resolution and how lesson numbers are mapped to stable UUIDs. Include examples of valid template file paths and their structure. Describe how the file system acts as the source of truth for lesson templates before AI personalization. Provide guidance on adding new templates and maintaining backward compatibility. Address common issues such as missing files, incorrect naming conventions, and how the system handles template load failures gracefully.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Routes
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for all backend API endpoints in the persona application. Document each route's HTTP method, URL pattern, request parameters, request body schema, response format, and authentication requirements. Include detailed descriptions of the data flow for each endpoint, such as how the /api/persona/personalize-template POST request processes user_id and lesson_number to generate personalized content using AI. Explain error handling patterns, CORS configuration, and validation logic used across routes. Provide concrete examples of request/response pairs from actual implementation. Detail the relationship between API routes and underlying services like Supabase database operations and OpenAI integration. Address security considerations including input sanitization and rate limiting implications.

wiki_catalogs.name: Frontend Architecture Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the frontend structure of the persona application. Explain the Next.js App Router organization, including route groups like (dashboard), layout inheritance, and server-side rendering patterns. Detail the role of root and dashboard-specific layouts in providing consistent UI scaffolding. Describe the initial page routing logic in page.tsx that redirects to the dashboard. Illustrate how data flows from server components to client components. Include performance considerations such as server-side rendering benefits and initial load optimization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Schema
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the persona application's PostgreSQL database schema defined in 001_init.sql. Detail each table: courses (id, slug, title), lessons (id, course_id, lesson_number, title, content JSONB), lesson_descriptions (lesson_id, data JSONB), profiles (user_identifier, survey JSONB), personalized_lesson_descriptions (profile_id, lesson_id, content JSONB), and lesson_assets. Document primary keys, foreign key relationships, constraints, and triggers such as set_timestamps(). Explain the purpose of each table in the personalization workflow. Map each table to its corresponding TypeScript interface in types.ts, showing how Row, Insert, and Update types correspond to database operations. Include sample records for each table and describe query patterns used in the application. Document indexing strategies and performance considerations for large-scale personalization data.

wiki_catalogs.name: GetCourse Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for integrating the persona application with GetCourse LMS. Detail the two-part integration process: embedding the survey iframe for user profile collection and injecting personalized lesson blocks into course content. Explain how the {uid} and {real_name} placeholders from GetCourse are used to pre-fill survey fields and link profiles. Document the exact HTML and JavaScript code snippets from GETCOURSE_HTML_CODES.md for both survey and lesson block integration. Describe the data flow from GetCourse → persona survey → Supabase profile → AI personalization → lesson block rendering. Include instructions for mapping lesson titles and keywords in the data-lesson attribute. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common issues like failed block loading, missing styles, or incorrect user identifier propagation. Reference the styling in public/getcourse/ and persona/styles.css to ensure visual consistency.

wiki_catalogs.name: POST /api/persona/personalize-template
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the POST /api/persona/personalize-template endpoint that generates AI-personalized lesson content. Document the request structure including user_id, lesson_number, and optional flush parameter. Detail the response format with personalized JSON content containing fields like summary_short, homework_20m, and practical_tasks. Explain the workflow: loading template from file system, invoking GPT-4o-mini via OpenAI client, saving result to Supabase, and returning HTML-ready output. Include error handling for AI failures with fallback to original template. Provide example requests with cURL and TypeScript fetch, showing how to handle CORS and JSON responses. Document authentication via Supabase auth and rate limiting considerations. Specify success (200) and error (400, 404, 500) status codes with example payloads.

wiki_catalogs.name: Vercel Deployment
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for deploying the persona application on Vercel. Document the step-by-step deployment process including environment variable configuration (NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL, NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY), framework detection, and build settings (build command: pnpm build, output directory: .next). Explain the purpose of vercel.json configuration and its integration with Next.js. Include instructions for testing locally using pnpm install, pnpm build, and pnpm start. Address common deployment issues such as missing environment variables, Git integration problems, and dependency resolution with pnpm. Provide guidance on verifying successful deployment through the Vercel dashboard and accessing the application at the assigned URL. Include performance considerations for serverless functions and caching strategies for API routes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Migrations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the database migration system in the persona application. Explain the purpose of the Supabase-based PostgreSQL schema management using the migrations/ directory and the run-migrations.ts script. Detail the initialization process, schema structure defined in 001_init.sql, and the role of each table (profiles, lessons, personalized_lesson_descriptions). Document how run-migrations.ts connects to Supabase, applies schema changes, and handles errors. Provide step-by-step execution instructions, including required environment variables (SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY), and integration with deployment workflows. Include troubleshooting tips for common migration failures, such as connection timeouts or SQL syntax errors, and best practices for maintaining idempotent, version-controlled schema changes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Unit Testing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the unit testing strategy in the persona application using Vitest. Explain how pure functions in lib/utils.ts and API service utilities in lib/api/ are tested in isolation. Document the test setup via setupTests.ts and environment configuration in env.test.ts. Include examples from app.test.tsx demonstrating component rendering tests. Detail mocking strategies for dependencies, assertion patterns, and snapshot testing where applicable. Explain how test files are co-located or mapped under the test/ directory. Provide guidance on writing new unit tests for utility functions and pure components, including best practices for test readability, coverage, and performance. Address common issues such as mock leakage, timing problems, and environment mismatches.

wiki_catalogs.name: Survey Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for integrating the persona survey with GetCourse. Explain how to embed the survey iframe using the provided HTML template from GETCOURSE_HTML_CODES.md, including proper styling and responsive behavior. Document the use of {uid} and {real_name} placeholders for pre-filling user data, and describe the post-message event flow upon survey completion that returns the profileId and dashboardUrl. Include instructions for handling the SURVEY_COMPLETED event in GetCourse to redirect users or display personalized links. Reference the adaptive iframe height strategy for mobile devices and security considerations for message event validation. Provide troubleshooting tips for common issues like iframe loading failures, blocked scripts, or missing user data propagation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Profile Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the profile-related UI components in the persona application. Explain the purpose and usage of ProfileSelector for user profile selection and ProfileSurvey for collecting user data through interactive forms. Document component props, state management, form handling with validation, and integration with the /api/survey endpoint. Provide code examples showing how these components interact with router state and Supabase-backed profile data. Address accessibility considerations, responsive behavior, and error handling during form submission. Include guidance on extending these components for additional profile fields or custom validation logic.

wiki_catalogs.name: Lesson Import
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the lesson import functionality implemented in import-lessons.ts. Explain how the script seeds lesson data from the file system (store/shvz/lessons/) into the Supabase database, including course creation, lesson upsertion, description storage, and asset linking. Document the data flow from JSON files to database records in 'lessons', 'lesson_descriptions', and 'lesson_assets' tables. Provide examples of the expected JSON structure in lesson.json and demonstrate how course metadata from course.json is used. Include configuration requirements such as COURSE_STORE_PATH, NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL, and SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY. Address error handling for missing files or database conflicts, and explain the script's role in the initial data population workflow.

wiki_catalogs.name: Direct Lesson Update
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the direct lesson number update mechanism implemented in update-lesson-numbers.ts. Explain how this script uses the PostgreSQL client to directly connect to the Supabase database and synchronize lesson numbers by reading lesson titles from the file system templates in the store/shvz/lessons directory. Document the use of Node.js fs and path modules for file traversal and JSON parsing, and describe the mapping logic that aligns folder-based lesson files with database records. Highlight the script's reliance on environment variables like SUPABASE_DB_URL and its use of raw SQL queries for updates. Discuss the risks of concurrent modifications due to lack of transactional safety, and provide examples of how mismatches between file and database titles are handled. Include guidance on when this approach is appropriate (e.g., development environments) and troubleshooting tips for common issues such as connection failures or file read errors.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on onboarding new developers to the persona project. Provide step-by-step instructions for cloning the repository, installing dependencies with pnpm, setting up environment variables (SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY, OPENAI_API_KEY, COURSE_STORE_PATH), and running the application locally. Include commands for starting the dev server, running tests, and executing database migrations. Document prerequisites such as Node.js version, pnpm installation, and access to Supabase/OpenAI accounts. Provide troubleshooting tips for common setup issues like missing environment variables or database connection errors. Include a simple 'Hello World' style example of making a request to one of the API endpoints. Ensure the guide works for both macOS and Linux environments and reference the configuration files that control behavior.

wiki_catalogs.name: AI Processing Workflow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the AI processing workflow at the core of the personalization engine. Explain the end-to-end flow: constructing the prompt with user survey data and lesson template, sending requests to OpenAI's GPT-4o-mini model via the OpenAI SDK, handling responses, and parsing JSON output. Document the prompt engineering strategy, including role definition, context formatting, and strict output requirements. Detail error handling when the AI service fails and the fallback to original templates. Include configuration parameters like temperature, max_tokens, and model selection. Provide real examples of input prompts and AI-generated outputs. Explain how to modify prompts for different teaching styles or content formats while maintaining JSON schema integrity.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Access
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the database access layer in the persona application. Explain the implementation of createSupabaseServerClient function and its role in server-side data operations. Document the database schema defined in 001_init.sql, including tables (courses, lessons, profiles, personalized_lesson_descriptions), their relationships, constraints, and indexing strategy. Describe the use of PostgreSQL extensions like pgcrypto and trigger functions for timestamp management. Explain row-level security considerations and service role key usage. Detail type safety implementation through Database type from lib/supabase/types.ts. Provide examples of common query patterns used in API routes and their performance implications. Address connection management, error handling, and best practices for interacting with Supabase from Next.js server components.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component Hierarchy and Structure
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the component hierarchy in the persona application. Describe the domain-specific components such as ProfileSelector and PersonalizationEditor, including their props, state management, and interaction with router and API endpoints. Document the UI component library built on Radix primitives and styled with Tailwind CSS, covering usage of Button, Card, Input, Textarea, Badge, ScrollArea, and Separator. Explain the theme-provider.tsx implementation for dark/light mode toggling. Provide code examples demonstrating component composition and best practices for extending the UI library. Address accessibility features and responsive design patterns implemented across components.

wiki_catalogs.name: File-Based Data Models
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the file-based data structures used in the persona application. Detail the structure of user_profiles.json including fields like user_identifier, name, survey responses (motivation, fears, target_clients), and derived attributes (goals, problems). Document the course.json structure defining course metadata and lesson sequencing. Describe the lesson template JSON structure in the store/shvz/lessons/ directory, including fields such as summary_short, why_watch, quick_action, social_share, and homework_20m. Explain how these templates are merged with AI-generated content during personalization. Document course_quiz.json for assessment logic and videos_list.json for media mapping. Include sample data for each file type and explain how these files are resolved at runtime. Cover versioning, fallback mechanisms, and update workflows via scripts like regenerate-lesson-templates.ts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Other Integrations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for non-GetCourse integrations involving the core APIs and services. Explain how external systems can interact with the personalization engine through the /api/persona/block endpoint by sending user_id and lesson parameters. Document the CORS configuration that enables cross-origin requests from external domains. Describe integration possibilities with other LMS platforms using the same iframe and JavaScript injection pattern as GetCourse. Cover authentication considerations when exposing APIs to third-party systems. Include examples of direct API consumption for retrieving personalized content programmatically. Address security implications of exposing the personalization API and best practices for rate limiting and API key management.

wiki_catalogs.name: GET /api/lessons
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the GET /api/lessons endpoint that retrieves lesson metadata. Document query parameters such as lesson_number for filtering and the response schema including id, title, duration, and status. Explain integration with the file-based lesson storage in store/shvz/lessons/ and how lesson.json files are mapped to API responses. Include examples of fetching all lessons and retrieving a specific lesson by number. Detail error conditions (404 for invalid lesson number, 500 for database errors) and caching strategies. Provide TypeScript and JavaScript examples using fetch to demonstrate client-side integration. Address performance considerations for large lesson sets and pagination requirements if applicable.

wiki_catalogs.name: Railway Deployment
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for deploying the persona application on Railway. Document the preparation steps including repository optimization by excluding large files via .gitignore and removing video assets to reduce project size. Explain the railway.json configuration including Nixpacks builder, start command (php -S 0.0.0.0:$PORT), health check path, and timeout settings. Detail the environment variable setup (OPENAI_API_KEY, KINESCOPE_API_KEY) in the Railway dashboard. Cover the post-deployment data loading process for course content into the store/ directory. Describe the hybrid deployment model where code runs on Railway while static assets may be served via CDN or external storage. Compare the Hobby Plan ($5/month) specifications (512MB RAM, 1GB storage) with alternative solutions like DigitalOcean or VPS. Include instructions for verifying deployment through provided URLs and troubleshooting deployment failures related to resource limits or configuration errors.

wiki_catalogs.name: Lesson Management Scripts
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature section focused on lesson lifecycle management scripts. Cover the functionality of import-lessons.ts for seeding lesson data into Supabase, regenerate-lesson-templates.ts for AI-driven template updates using OpenAI, and fix-remaining-lessons.ts for post-processing incomplete entries. Explain the three variants of update-lesson-numbers scripts: direct DB update (update-lesson-numbers.ts), safe transactional update (update-lesson-numbers-safe.ts), and API-mediated update (update-lesson-numbers-api.ts), highlighting their use cases and safety guarantees. Document input sources (store/shvz/lessons/), required configurations, and execution order dependencies. Provide real-world examples of regenerating all templates after a prompt change or fixing lessons after a partial import failure. Address error recovery, logging, and performance considerations when processing large lesson sets.

wiki_catalogs.name: Integration Testing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the integration testing approach using Mock Service Worker (MSW). Explain how MSW intercepts API calls to Supabase and OpenAI in both Node.js (server) and browser environments via server.ts and browser.ts. Document the request handlers defined in handlers.ts that simulate responses for /api/persona/personalize-template and profile management endpoints. Describe how integration tests validate data flow between frontend components and mocked backend services. Include setup procedures in setupTests.ts and how mocks are activated per test suite. Provide code examples showing mocked personalization workflows and error simulation. Address common challenges such as handler conflicts, timing issues, and maintaining mock fidelity. Offer best practices for keeping mocks synchronized with actual API contracts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Lesson Block Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for integrating personalized lesson blocks into GetCourse course pages. Explain the purpose of the data-lesson and data-title attributes in mapping course content to AI-generated personalizations. Provide step-by-step instructions for inserting the universal JavaScript template into each lesson, customizing the ID and data attributes accordingly. Document how the client-side script fetches personalized content from the /api/persona/block endpoint using the user's UID, and dynamically injects the HTML response into the page while loading external styles from persona/styles.css. Highlight the conditional loading of CSS to prevent duplication. Include the exact code snippets from GETCOURSE_HTML_CODES.md for lessons 1-12 and explain how keyword matching works in the backend. Address common issues such as blocks not appearing, incorrect personalization, missing styles, or JavaScript errors, and provide debugging strategies including console logging and network inspection.

wiki_catalogs.name: Personalization Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the personalization-specific components: PersonalizationEditor and PersonalizedLesson. Detail how PersonalizationEditor enables admins to modify AI-generated lesson content via a JSON interface integrated with Supabase storage, including its use of controlled inputs, real-time preview, and save functionality. Explain how PersonalizedLesson renders customized educational content based on user profiles and AI output. Document props, data flow from API responses, and rendering logic for dynamic content blocks. Provide usage examples, error fallback strategies, and performance tips for rendering large JSON-based lesson structures. Include integration points with the personalization engine and dashboard routing.

wiki_catalogs.name: Template Regeneration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the AI-driven template regeneration process in regenerate-lesson-templates.ts. Explain how the script uses OpenAI's GPT-4o model to generate structured lesson templates from raw transcripts, following a strict prompt that enforces factual accuracy and consistent formatting. Document the workflow: reading lesson metadata and transcripts, constructing the AI prompt with specific output requirements, processing the JSON response, and saving the generated template with proper file naming and backup procedures. Include details about the required OPENAI_API_KEY, the lesson-to-ID mapping, and the output format expected by the personalization engine. Provide examples of successful template generation and discuss error recovery strategies for failed API calls or parsing errors.

wiki_catalogs.name: Safe Transactional Update
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the safe transactional lesson number update mechanism in update-lesson-numbers-safe.ts. Explain the two-phase update strategy: first assigning temporary lesson numbers (starting from 1000) to avoid conflicts during reordering, then applying the correct final numbers. Document the use of the Supabase client (via @supabase/supabase-js) instead of direct PostgreSQL connections, and how this enables better integration with Supabase's authentication and row-level security. Describe the script's error handling between phases and its ability to prevent primary key violations during renumbering. Compare this approach with the direct update method, emphasizing its suitability for production environments where data integrity is critical. Provide real-world scenarios where this script prevents race conditions and ensures consistency, and include best practices for validating the outcome post-execution.

wiki_catalogs.name: Technology Stack
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the technology stack used in the persona application. Detail each major component: Next.js 15 with App Router for server-side rendering, React 19 for component model, TypeScript for type safety, Tailwind CSS for styling, and Supabase for PostgreSQL database and authentication. Explain the role of supporting libraries including Zod for validation, OpenAI SDK for AI content generation, Playwright and Vitest for testing, and MSW for API mocking. Document version constraints and compatibility requirements. Include performance characteristics of the chosen stack and rationale for key technology decisions. Provide links to official documentation for each major technology and note any custom configurations in the project that deviate from defaults.

wiki_catalogs.name: HTML Output Generation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the HTML generation process that transforms AI-personalized JSON content into embeddable HTML blocks. Explain the formatPersonalizedContent function's role in rendering structured content with conditional section inclusion based on available fields. Document the CSS classes used for styling and how the output integrates with external systems like GetCourse via iframe embedding. Include examples of generated HTML and how each JSON field maps to a visual component. Describe the responsive design considerations and accessibility features implemented in the output. Provide guidance on customizing the HTML template for different branding requirements or additional content sections while preserving functionality.

wiki_catalogs.name: AI Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the AI integration component of the persona application. Detail the implementation of the personalizeTemplate function that uses OpenAI's GPT-4o-mini model to generate personalized lesson content. Explain the prompt engineering strategy that incorporates user survey data, name, and lesson templates to produce contextually relevant output. Document the error handling and fallback mechanism that returns original templates when AI processing fails. Describe the configuration of the OpenAI client, including temperature settings and token limits. Provide examples of input prompts and generated JSON responses. Explain the security considerations around API key management and rate limiting. Address performance optimization techniques such as caching strategies and response validation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Fetching and State Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation on data fetching and state management strategies in the frontend. Explain how client components use React useState and useEffect hooks to manage local UI state, while fetching data from API routes via fetch calls in components like ProfileSelector and PersonalizationEditor. Detail the integration between frontend components and backend APIs, including request construction, error handling, and response processing. Contrast server-side data fetching in page components with client-side interactions. Document the use of Supabase for real-time data where applicable. Include examples of form handling, optimistic updates, and error recovery in personalization workflows.

wiki_catalogs.name: POST /api/survey
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the POST /api/survey endpoint used to submit user profile data. Document the request body schema including user_identifier, name, age, experience_level, goals, and pain_points. Explain how the survey data is stored in the profiles table with upsert behavior based on user_identifier. Detail validation using Zod and error responses for invalid payloads (400). Describe the successful response format with profile ID and redirect instructions. Provide real-world examples of survey submission from the frontend component and curl commands. Explain integration with the profile selector UI and how subsequent personalization requests use this stored data. Include security considerations around PII storage and Supabase RLS policies.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Personalization Scripts
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for this sub-feature section focused on user data and personalization update scripts. Explain the purpose of each script: update-user-simple.ts for direct database personalization updates, update-user-via-api.ts for testing API-driven updates, and update-user-personalizations.ts for batch processing multiple users. Document their interaction with the Supabase database and the /api/persona/personalize-template endpoint, including authentication requirements and payload structures. Detail use cases such as backfilling personalizations for existing users, testing personalization logic, or migrating legacy user data. Provide command-line usage examples, required parameters (e.g., profileId, lessonId), and expected output formats. Include guidance on avoiding race conditions, handling API rate limits, and validating personalization results. Address debugging strategies and logging mechanisms for troubleshooting failed personalization jobs.

wiki_catalogs.name: End-to-End Testing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the end-to-end testing suite implemented with Playwright. Document how basic.spec.ts validates critical user journeys such as survey submission, profile creation, and personalized lesson rendering. Explain the configuration in playwright.config.ts including browser targets, test timeouts, and CI/CD integration settings. Detail how tests interact with real UI components like profile-survey.tsx and navigate through pages including /survey and /dashboard. Include examples of locator strategies, form submissions, and assertions on personalized content. Cover execution modes (headed/headless), screenshot/video capture for debugging, and parallel test running. Address common failures like element not found, navigation timeouts, and state persistence issues. Provide guidelines for adding new E2E scenarios and maintaining test resilience against UI changes.

wiki_catalogs.name: UI Primitives and Component Library
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Document the foundational UI component library built on Radix UI primitives and styled with Tailwind CSS. Cover each primitive including Button, Input, Textarea, Card, Badge, ScrollArea, and Separator—detailing their props, styling conventions, accessibility features, and responsive behaviors. Explain the wrapper pattern used to enhance Radix components with project-specific defaults and Tailwind utility classes. Provide usage guidelines, composition patterns, and examples demonstrating how to combine these primitives into higher-level interfaces. Address theming consistency, keyboard navigation support, and best practices for extending the library with new components while maintaining design system integrity.

wiki_catalogs.name: Lesson Number Updates
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the lesson number update mechanisms, covering three distinct approaches: direct database updates (update-lesson-numbers.ts), safe transactional updates using temporary numbering (update-lesson-numbers-safe.ts), and API-mediated updates (update-lesson-numbers-api.ts), plus the specialized fix-remaining-lessons.ts for correcting specific misnumbered entries. Explain the technical differences between these scripts, including their use of PostgreSQL client vs. Supabase client, and their respective safety guarantees. Document the common goal of synchronizing lesson numbers between the database and file system templates. Provide guidance on when to use each variant based on environment constraints and data integrity requirements. Include examples of resolving numbering inconsistencies and discuss error handling and logging practices across all scripts.

wiki_catalogs.name: API-Mediated Update
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the API-mediated lesson number update process implemented in update-lesson-numbers-api.ts. Explain how this script uses the Supabase client to interact with the database through the same interface as the application's frontend, ensuring consistency with application-level business logic and security rules. Document the script's environment variable dependencies (NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY), and how it falls back to the anon key if the service role key is unavailable. Describe the workflow of fetching lessons, matching them with file system templates, and updating records via Supabase's .from().update() API. Highlight the advantages of this approach in environments where direct database access is restricted, and contrast it with the direct PostgreSQL client approach. Include guidance on debugging API response errors and handling rate limits or network interruptions during batch updates.

wiki_catalogs.name: Directory Structure
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the project's directory layout and file organization. Break down each top-level directory: app/ for Next.js pages and API routes, components/ for reusable UI elements, lib/ for shared utilities, migrations/ for database schema, public/ for static assets, scripts/ for data operations, store/ for lesson templates, and test/ for testing infrastructure. Explain the purpose of special directories like (dashboard) for route grouping and [profileId] for dynamic routing. Document naming conventions, file extensions, and organizational patterns used throughout the codebase. Highlight important configuration files and their roles in the development workflow. Provide guidance on where to place new files when extending the system.

wiki_catalogs.name: UI Library Implementation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Document the implementation of the custom UI library built on Radix UI and Tailwind CSS. For each component (Button, Card, Input, Textarea, Badge, ScrollArea, Separator), describe its purpose, props interface, styling mechanism using class-variance-authority and clsx, and accessibility features. Explain how these primitives are designed for reusability and consistency across the application. Provide usage examples for each component in both standalone and composed scenarios. Address theming support through CSS variables and integration with the global theme provider. Include performance considerations such as minimal re-renders and efficient styling.

wiki_catalogs.name: GET/POST /api/profiles/[profileId]/personalizations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Document the RESTful endpoints for managing personalizations per user profile. Cover both GET (retrieve all personalizations for a profile) and POST (create/update personalization for a lesson) methods. Detail URL parameter [profileId] binding and validation. For GET, explain the response structure with lesson_id, content JSON, and timestamps. For POST, document the required fields: lesson_id and content (structured JSON matching template schema). Explain integration with the admin dashboard's personalization editor and how Supabase upsert operations ensure data consistency. Include examples of fetching a user's personalization history and updating a specific lesson's content. Address authentication requirements and row-level security enforcement via Supabase.

wiki_catalogs.name: Theme Management and Provider
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the theme-provider.tsx implementation that enables dark/light mode toggling across the application. Explain how the provider uses React context and localStorage to persist user theme preferences. Document the integration with Tailwind CSS via class-based theming, the use of data attributes for theme detection, and coordination with system preferences. Provide examples of consuming the theme context in components and triggering theme switches via UI controls. Address hydration considerations in Next.js App Router, performance implications, and accessibility impacts of contrast ratios. Include instructions for adding custom themes or modifying existing theme variables.

wiki_catalogs.name: Specific Lesson Fixes
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the targeted lesson correction script fix-remaining-lessons.ts, designed to resolve specific misnumbered entries that remain after bulk updates. Explain how this script addresses edge cases where lesson titles do not match the standard naming pattern or were incorrectly numbered due to manual entry errors. Document the hardcoded mapping of known incorrect titles (e.g., '1 Урок Демонстрация') to their correct lesson numbers, and how Supabase's .eq() filter is used to precisely target affected records. Describe the post-update verification step that logs all lesson titles and numbers to confirm successful correction. Discuss the script's role as a remediation tool rather than a general-purpose updater, and provide examples of when it should be used—such as after migration anomalies or data import errors. Include best practices for extending the mapping list and ensuring idempotency in repeated executions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Frontend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the frontend component of the persona application. Describe the Next.js App Router structure, server and client component patterns, and data fetching strategies. Document the component hierarchy starting from layout.tsx through page-level components to atomic UI elements in the components/ui directory. Explain state management approaches, including when to use React state vs Supabase data. Detail the UI library implementation using Radix primitives styled with Tailwind CSS. Cover responsive design considerations, accessibility practices, and theming via theme-provider.tsx. Illustrate with examples how profile-selector and personalization-editor components interact with backend APIs. Include performance optimization techniques like code splitting and lazy loading.

wiki_catalogs.name: Navigation and Routing System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the navigation and routing architecture in the Next.js App Router. Explain the routing structure including public routes, dashboard routes under (dashboard) route group, and dynamic profile routes. Describe how layout.tsx files provide shared UI elements across route segments. Document the client-side navigation using Next.js Link and useRouter in components like ProfileSelector. Explain the redirect logic from the root page to the dashboard. Cover URL search parameter usage for profile selection and state persistence. Include best practices for route organization and code splitting in large-scale applications.

wiki_catalogs.name: GET /api/personalizations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the GET /api/personalizations endpoint that retrieves global personalization templates. Explain its role in providing default templates when user-specific data is unavailable. Document query parameters for filtering by lesson_number and the response format containing template_id, lesson_id, content structure, and creation timestamp. Describe how this endpoint serves as fallback for the personalization engine when no user-specific record exists. Provide example responses showing the JSON template structure used by AI processing. Include usage examples from the personalization editor interface and explain caching considerations for frequently accessed templates. Detail error handling for database connectivity issues and empty result sets.

wiki_catalogs.name: Backend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the backend component of the persona application. Describe the API route structure under app/api/, including RESTful patterns and request/response handling. Explain server-side data flow from API routes to Supabase database operations using the server client. Document the authentication model using Supabase auth and row-level security. Cover the integration with OpenAI for AI-powered personalization and error handling strategies. Detail the database schema design, relationships between tables (profiles, lessons, personalized_lesson_descriptions), and indexing strategy. Include security considerations like CORS headers, input validation, and protection against injection attacks. Provide insights into server-side rendering implications and caching mechanisms.

wiki_catalogs.name: POST /api/persona/block
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop documentation for the POST /api/persona/block endpoint that processes individual content blocks within a lesson template. Document the request structure containing block_type (e.g., 'summary', 'homework'), raw_content, user_profile, and lesson_context. Explain how this endpoint enables granular AI processing of specific lesson components rather than full lessons. Detail the response format with enhanced content, formatting instructions, and metadata. Describe its internal usage by the personalization engine during template processing. Include example payloads for different block types and show how the OpenAI client is invoked with specific prompts per block type. Address rate limiting implications due to multiple block calls per lesson and error recovery strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Personalization Engine
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the AI-powered personalization engine at the core of the persona application. Detail the workflow: receiving a personalization request, loading the base JSON template from the file system, retrieving user profile data from Supabase, sending context to OpenAI's GPT-4o-mini model, processing the AI response, saving results to the database, and generating HTML output. Explain the template loading strategy, including lesson ID mapping and fallback mechanisms when personalization is unavailable. Document the prompt engineering approach used in AI requests and content formatting logic. Include performance considerations like caching (cached flag in responses) and rate limiting. Provide examples of input templates and output personalizations, and explain how to modify the AI prompts for different content styles.

wiki_catalogs.name: GET /api/debug
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the GET /api/debug endpoint used for system diagnostics and status monitoring. Document the comprehensive response payload including system_version, database_connection_status, supabase_auth_status, openai_api_status, template_directory_integrity, and recent_error_logs. Explain its role in deployment verification and production troubleshooting. Detail authentication requirements (admin-only access) and security restrictions. Provide example responses showing healthy vs. degraded system states. Include usage examples from operations teams during deployment validation and incident response. Explain how this endpoint integrates with external monitoring tools and supports query parameters like 'check=database' for targeted diagnostics.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Models & Database Schema
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the persona application's database schema and data structures. Detail each table: profiles (user_identifier, survey, name), lessons (lesson_number, title, content), and personalized_lesson_descriptions (profile_id, lesson_id, content JSON). Document primary keys, foreign keys, indexes, and constraints defined in the SQL migration. Explain the TypeScript interfaces in types.ts that represent these models. Cover the JSON structure used in lesson templates and personalization content, including fields like summary_short, why_watch, quick_action, social_share, and homework_20m. Include sample data records and describe data access patterns. Document data lifecycle management, including how old personalizations are updated via scripts and retention policies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Admin Dashboard
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the admin dashboard functionality in the persona application. Describe the navigation structure under the (dashboard) route group, including the main dashboard view and profile-specific personalization editor. Explain how administrators select users and lessons to view or edit existing personalizations. Document the personalization-editor component's interface, including JSON editing capabilities and save workflows. Cover access control considerations and audit trails for changes. Provide use cases for common administrative tasks like fixing AI-generated content or creating manual personalizations. Include screenshots or mockups showing the UI layout and interaction patterns. Explain how the dashboard integrates with the same API endpoints used by the frontend.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for all public endpoints in the persona application. For each endpoint, document HTTP methods, URL patterns, request parameters, request body schema, response formats, status codes, and authentication requirements. Start with POST /api/persona/personalize-template for generating personalized content, then cover GET /api/lessons for lesson retrieval, POST /api/survey for profile creation, and CRUD operations for personalizations. Include detailed examples of requests and responses, especially for the personalization flow with user_id, lesson_number, and flush parameters. Document CORS headers and cross-origin access policies. Explain error handling patterns and common failure scenarios. Provide client implementation examples in JavaScript/TypeScript showing how to integrate with the API from external applications.

wiki_catalogs.name: Integration Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on integrating the persona application with external systems, particularly the GetCourse LMS platform. Detail the embedding process using iframe integration at /survey/iframe and lesson personalization blocks. Explain how the static HTML templates in public/getcourse/ are used to maintain branding consistency across platforms. Document the data exchange patterns between systems, including user identifier propagation and single sign-on considerations. Cover the CORS configuration that enables cross-domain API access. Provide step-by-step instructions for setting up the integration, including where to place tracking codes and how to configure redirect URLs. Include troubleshooting tips for common integration issues like broken iframes or missing personalization data.

wiki_catalogs.name: Deployment & Operations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on deploying and operating the persona application in production environments. Document the configuration and deployment process for both Vercel and Railway platforms, including platform-specific configuration files (vercel.json, railway.json) and environment variable requirements. Explain the differences between the two deployment options in terms of cost, performance, and storage limitations. Cover the post-deployment setup steps like running migrations and importing lesson data. Include monitoring strategies, logging practices, and backup procedures. Provide guidance on scaling considerations and performance optimization for high-traffic scenarios. Document the health check endpoint and deployment verification process to ensure system readiness.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Management Scripts
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the data management and maintenance scripts in the persona application. Document the purpose and usage of each script in the scripts/ directory, including database migrations (run-migrations.ts), lesson data import (import-lessons.ts), template regeneration (regenerate-lesson-templates.ts), and various user personalization update scripts. Explain the execution workflow, required parameters, and expected outcomes for each script. Cover the dependency on environment variables and database connectivity. Provide examples of command-line usage and typical execution sequences during system setup or updates. Include error handling and recovery procedures when scripts fail. Document the idempotent nature of certain scripts and precautions to avoid data corruption.

wiki_catalogs.name: Testing Strategy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the testing approach in the persona application. Document the unit testing strategy using Vitest for utility functions in lib/ and pure components. Cover the end-to-end testing implementation with Playwright for critical user journeys like survey submission and lesson personalization. Explain the API mocking setup using MSW (Mock Service Worker) to isolate tests from external dependencies like Supabase and OpenAI. Detail the test organization in the test/ directory and configuration in vitest.config.ts and playwright.config.ts. Include code coverage expectations and continuous integration considerations. Provide examples of test cases for key functionality and guidance on writing new tests when adding features.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis: Persona Personalization Platform

## 1. Project Introduction

### Purpose Statement
The Persona project is a Next.js-based personalization platform designed to deliver customized educational content for massage therapy students. The system integrates user profile data with AI-powered content generation to create personalized learning experiences.

### Core Goals and Objectives
- Provide personalized lesson content based on student profiles and survey responses
- Integrate with Supabase for data persistence and user management
- Leverage OpenAI's GPT models to dynamically adapt educational materials
- Support seamless integration with external learning platforms like GetCourse
- Enable administrators to manage and edit personalizations through a dashboard interface

### Target Audience
- Massage therapy students who receive personalized learning content
- Educators and administrators who manage course materials and personalizations
- System operators who deploy and maintain the platform infrastructure

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown
The application follows a modern full-stack architecture with clear separation of concerns:

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Client Browser] --> B[Next.js App Router]
    B --> C[API Routes]
    C --> D[Supabase Database]
    C --> E[OpenAI API]
    C --> F[File System Templates]
    D --> G[User Profiles]
    D --> H[Lessons]
    D --> I[Personalizations]
    F --> J[JSON Lesson Templates]
```

### Design Patterns
The system implements several key architectural patterns:
- **Server Components**: Next.js App Router for server-side rendering
- **API Routes**: RESTful endpoints for data operations
- **Dependency Injection**: Supabase client creation through factory functions
- **Template Method**: JSON templates enhanced with personalization
- **CQRS Pattern**: Separate read (GET) and write (POST) operations for personalizations

### System Relationships
```mermaid
graph TD
    App[Next.js Application] --> Supabase[Supabase Backend]
    App --> OpenAI[OpenAI API]
    App --> FileSystem[Template Files]
    Supabase --> Profiles[Profiles Table]
    Supabase --> Lessons[Lessons Table]
    Supabase --> Personalizations[Personalized Content]
    FileSystem --> LessonTemplates[JSON Templates]
    AdminDashboard --> PersonalizationEditor
    PersonalizationEditor --> API[POST /api/personalizations]
    API --> Database[Supabase]
```

### Data Flow Diagram
```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[User Profile] --> B[Survey Data]
    B --> C[Personalization API]
    C --> D[Template Retrieval]
    D --> E[AI Processing]
    E --> F[Content Generation]
    F --> G[Database Storage]
    G --> H[Frontend Delivery]
    H --> I[Personalized Lesson]
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- **Home Page**: `app/page.tsx` - Main landing page with navigation to dashboard
- **Dashboard**: `app/(dashboard)/dashboard/page.tsx` - Administrative interface
- **API Endpoints**: `app/api/` - RESTful API routes for data operations
- **Survey Interface**: `app/survey/page.tsx` - User profile collection

### Core Modules
- **Personalization Engine**: `app/api/persona/personalize-template/route.ts` - AI-powered content adaptation
- **Supabase Integration**: `lib/supabase/` - Database connectivity layer
- **UI Components**: `components/` - Reusable React components with Tailwind styling
- **Data Access Layer**: `lib/api/` - Business logic for data operations

### Configuration Approach
The project uses standard Next.js configuration with environment variables for external services:

```mermaid
graph LR
    Config[Configuration] --> Next[Next.js Config]
    Config --> Env[Environment Variables]
    Config --> Supabase[Supabase Settings]
    Config --> OpenAI[OpenAI API Key]
    Next --> next.config.ts
    Env --> .env
    Supabase --> lib/supabase/server.ts
    OpenAI --> lib/openai.ts
```

Sources:
- [next.config.ts](next.config.ts)
- [server.ts](lib/supabase/server.ts)

### External Dependencies
The project leverages several key external dependencies:

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Web Application] --> B[Next.js 15]
    A --> C[React 19]
    A --> D[Supabase]
    A --> E[OpenAI]
    A --> F[Tailwind CSS]
    B --> G[Server Components]
    C --> H[Client Components]
    D --> I[PostgreSQL Database]
    E --> J[GPT-4o-mini]
    F --> K[Styling Framework]
```

Sources:
- [package.json](package.json)

### Integration Points
The system integrates with multiple external services:

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Persona Platform] --> B[Supabase Auth]
    A --> C[Supabase Database]
    A --> D[OpenAI API]
    A --> E[GetCourse LMS]
    B --> F[User Authentication]
    C --> G[Data Persistence]
    D --> H[AI Content Generation]
    E --> I[Lesson Delivery]
```

Sources:
- [personalize-template/route.ts](app/api/persona/personalize-template/route.ts)
- [server.ts](lib/supabase/server.ts)

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview
The platform delivers several key features:
- **Dynamic Content Personalization**: AI-powered adaptation of lesson content
- **User Profile Management**: Collection and storage of student information
- **Administrative Dashboard**: Interface for managing personalizations
- **Template-Based System**: JSON templates enhanced with personalized content
- **API-First Design**: RESTful endpoints for external integration

### Implementation Highlights
- **AI-Powered Personalization**: Uses OpenAI's GPT-4o-mini to adapt content based on user profiles
- **Multi-Source Template Loading**: Flexible template resolution system
- **CORS Support**: Proper headers for cross-origin requests
- **Error Resilience**: Graceful degradation when AI services fail
- **File-Based Template Storage**: JSON templates stored in the filesystem

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Idle
    Idle --> Processing: POST /personalize-template
    Processing --> TemplateLoaded: Load JSON template
    TemplateLoaded --> AISent: Send to OpenAI
    AISent --> AIResponse: Receive completion
    AIResponse --> FormatHTML: Format as HTML
    FormatHTML --> StoreDB: Save to Supabase
    StoreDB --> Success: Return HTML
    Processing --> Error: Validation failure
    AISent --> Error: API error
    Error --> ReturnDefault: Original template
    Success --> [*]
    ReturnDefault --> [*]
```

Sources:
- [personalize-template/route.ts](app/api/persona/personalize-template/route.ts)
- [personalization-editor.tsx](components/personalizations/personalization-editor.tsx)
- [personalizations.ts](lib/api/personalizations.ts)
</blog>
